definition: lit. Martian language/fig. Internet slang used to communicate secret messages that the general public or government can't understand
fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86
traditional form of Chinese, as opposed to simplified form 簡體|简体[jian3 ti3]
simplified Chinese character, as opposed to traditional Chinese character 繁體字|繁体字[fan2 ti3 zi4]
(computing) full pinyin (input method where the user types pinyin without tones, e.g. "shiqing" for 事情[shi4 qing5])
simplified form of Chinese characters, as opposed to traditional form 繁體|繁体[fan2 ti3]
mojibake (nonsense characters displayed when software fails to render text according to its intended character encoding)
standard form of a Chinese character/(Tw) traditional (i.e. unsimplified) characters
see 網絡語言|网络语言[wang3 luo4 yu3 yan2]
Mandarin phonetic symbols (MPS), phonetic alphabet for Chinese used esp. in Taiwan, also known colloquially as Bopomofo (after the first four letters of the alphabet:ㄅㄆㄇㄈ)
